member.name: T:OxyPlot.Wpf.Plot
member.remarks: This file contains dependency properties used for defining the plot in XAML. These properties are only used when Model is null. In this case an internal PlotModel is created and the dependency properties are copied from the control to the internal PlotModel.
member.summary: Represents a WPF control that displays an OxyPlot plot.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.Plot.OnKeyDown(System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled KeyDown attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.Plot.OnMouseDown(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled MouseDown attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data. This event data reports details about the mouse button that was pressed and the handled state.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.Plot.OnMouseMove(System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled MouseMove attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.Plot.OnMouseUp(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled MouseUp routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data. The event data reports that the mouse button was released.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.Plot.OnMouseWheel(System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled MouseWheel attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data.

member.params: This is only used in the plot controls.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.ShapesRenderContext.MeasureTextByGlyphTypeface(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Measures the size of the specified text by a faster method (using GlyphTypefaces).

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Wpf.ShapesRenderContext.DrawLineSegmentsByStreamGeometry(System.Collections.Generic.IList{OxyPlot.ScreenPoint},OxyPlot.OxyColor,System.Double,System.Double[],OxyPlot.OxyPenLineJoin,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws the line segments by stream geometry.
member.param: Draw aliased line if set to true .

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Wpf.ShapesRenderContext.PaintBackground
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to paint the background.
member.value: true if the background should be painted; otherwise, false .

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Wpf.ShapesRenderContext.TextMeasurementMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the text measurement method.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Wpf.ShapesRenderContext.UseStreamGeometry
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use stream geometry for lines and polygons rendering.
member.value: true if stream geometry should be used; otherwise, false .
member.remarks: The XamlWriter does not serialize StreamGeometry, so set this to false if you want to export to XAML. Using stream geometry seems to be slightly faster than using path geometry.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Wpf.ShapesRenderContext.CurrentToolTip
member.summary: Gets or sets the current tooltip.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Wpf.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Wpf.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.
